title: Gyeran Mari (Korean Rolled Omelette)
steps: Beat eggs in a bowl. Add scallions, carrot, and salt. Mix well.
Preheat a small skillet over medium-low heat until it feels hot when you place your hand 2-3 inches above the bottom.
Pour a thin layer of egg mixture into the pan (about ⅓ to ½ of total mixture for 3 eggs).
When egg is set but still wet on top, use two spatulas or chopsticks to fold the egg from one side.
Continue rolling the egg toward the opposite side of the pan.
Pull the rolled egg to one side of the pan.
Add a little more oil to the empty space, then pour another portion of egg mixture.
Lift the rolled egg to let the new egg mixture flow underneath.
When the new layer is set but still wet, continue rolling from the existing roll.
Repeat until all egg mixture is used (2-4 pours total depending on egg quantity).
Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
Slice into rounds and serve warm or at room temperature.
notes: For 5 eggs, use 3-4 pours. For 3 eggs, use 2-3 pours
Cook over gentle heat - too high and eggs will be tough and break when folded
Use a small skillet for thicker rolls
Popular as lunch box item and street food in Korea
Can add mushrooms, zucchini, bell peppers, garlic chives, ham, bacon, cheese, or gim (seaweed)
